author: captainhaiti
title: #CardanoBeach; ADA's city in Miami
description: How can Cardano empower Miami locals to save their community from Climate Gentrification?

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal give detailed information about the problem and give the solution clearly. The proposer solution is empowered by providing the co-working space with Cardano name. The proposal is very well structured and clear. Having a place with Cardano name that help economic development in a big city will provide a positive outcome for Cardano Ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal budget is detailed enough, and in the range of total challenge budget. The budget have been broken down to details of which marketing type the proposer chooses. My suggestion is to lowering budget of the Mascot and make online marketing budget higher, since Cardano is in the blockchain (Online). The proposer already have a dedicated team with experience that will ensure the success of this proposal. This proposal needs to include risks or worst case scenario.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer doesn't have any milestone and goals in the short term and not detailed enough. My suggestion is to give numbers to the milestone, the proposer mention "progress" and not "amount".

f6_assessments.q0: the target to increase cardano community in Miami Florida with free working space, DAO for property, and place for community to grow is good. it will help people from the community to interact with each other. but i dont see how the NFT will attract people around Miami to joining the community, since the workspace will be only useful for people who already joined the community. and this is much more beneficial to the NFT maker.
f6_assessments.q1: most of the $37.500 will be spend on billboard, mascott, advertisement. it's stated that this project need $300.000 to launch. i dont see how you will get the rest of the money. maybe you can state the details.
f6_assessments.q2:
its too long to take 6 months for preparation, the proposal maker already stated that the building is ready and they're already secured it for 10 years lease.
9 months to create NFT and 12 months to start the first DAO vote takes too much times. you should be moving faster since DAO NFT is in the hot trend.

f6_assessments.q0: Bold idea, really attractive project. The team has started, the web interface is intuitive. The project presents the right challenge, building the Cardano community in Miami, a coastal city. In particular, the project can be expanded and developed as it can generate revenue. The stages are oriented specifically, appropriately. For the challenge, I have a few suggestions for you to overcome the challenge, connect with the Cardano community through social channels such as telegram, facebook… You can attend the exhibition to promote ideas, book Event posters at the beach or shopping places.
f6_assessments.q1: The members who put money to start are very welcoming and energizing the project. If you provide a picture of the 5930 NE 2nd Avenue Miami Florida building, the interactivity will be much stronger. The project roadmap is suitable for the implementation time, the team has many strengths in different fields, the members' Linkedin channel is very impressive. I am completely convinced
f6_assessments.q2: the number of Yoroi wallets is a suitable quantification. I would like to add a few indicators that are easy to quantify such as: activity images, poster files, links to ads, mascot images, number of communities on social channels ... If you can do these things above, the community will closely monitor the project and fully support the project. Thank you for a great idea

f6_assessments.q0: A community in Miami, intended for creating a hub for blockchain innovation with utility NFT and token. This proposal is aligned with the challenge setting, which is to increase adoption and awareness of Cardano within local communities. From creating a utility NFT that can give access to a business incubator, to a $CaptainHaiti Gaming token to help educate Little Haiti’s youth on Cardano by playing games, would make this proposal able to scale in the future, also onboarding a lot of people into the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal provides their team profile, and it consists of people with relevant experience. We could verify their work with their project and their LinkedIn profile link. They have explained in detail about their plans, from Phase 1, Phase 2, to Phase 4. It is comprehensive and explained in detail. The budget is provided, but only in a general allocation. We need to also keep in mind that the $37,500 budget is 7.5% of the total challenge fund, which exceeded the ideal 5% maximum asking funding for each project. My suggestion would be to split this project into 2 or 3 different Fund, since it is a 12 months project. All in all, a well written and comprehensive proposal, only missing the budgeting detail into more detailed manner for each allocation area. For example: how will the media advertisement budget will be used? Because $10,000 is a lot to only generalize it, we need to see what kind of advertisement medium that they will use, etc.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal provides roadmap with milestones. The metrics and KPIs should be specified with target number and/or goals. For example: include the target metrics for number of people joined, number of NFTs minted, etc. Regarding auditability, they have a working website to upload their updates and progress, so it’s easy for public and the community to track their progress.

solution: Help Captain Haiti empower his community with the Cardano technology; to help increase ownership of their own neighborhood.
experience: Captain Haiti: $LHTC Crypto Grant creator, LittleHaitiBiz.comWhitney Lubin: Executive Director at CodeForSouth.orgPatrick Serafin: Blockchain Engineer, MintMatrix.comNita St-Hilaire: Head of Product, Emtech.comZohar Kauffman: Owner, BonAndOak.comMalika Lorenceau: UX/UI
